instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the rigatoni and cook according to package instructions for al dente (typically 8-12 minutes).
While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute, until fragrant.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Let the sauce simmer for 15-20 minutes, allowing it to thicken slightly. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Reserve about 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining the rigatoni.
Drain the cooked rigatoni and add it directly to the simmering sauce in the skillet. Toss to coat the pasta evenly.
Add a splash or two of reserved pasta water to create a desired consistency for the sauce (optional).
Serve immediately with fresh basil leaves and shredded parmesan cheese (optional).
